fields.headline: Hall marks
fields.bodyText: Trelights Farmhouse, Cornwall (01326 340153). £560-£1,200 per week. Sleeps 15-25. This self-catering, rambling eighteenth-century farmhouse is 10 minutes drive from the north coast. The kitchen has an oil-fired Aga as well as the mod cons essential to a party (large electric cooker, sinks, dishwasher and plenty of fridge and freezer space). Accommodation is fairly basic, the beds mainly bunks. A large garden and farmland surrounds the house, and there's a ping-pong table for rainy weather. Goscott House, Week St Mary, Cornwall (01326 555555). £838-£2,068 per week. Sleeps 12. This self-catering Victorian manor house is furnished with ornate oak panelling and shutters, slate flooring and worktops, brass beds, pine window seats, a huge oak dining table and an imposing ornamental fifteenth-century granite inglenook fireplace. The grounds extend to 130 acres of rolling green farmland around a beautiful wooded valley leading down to Widemouth Bay just three miles away. A problem for parties: smokers are not welcome. The Samling, Cumbria (01539 431 922). £3,000 per night. Sleeps 12. Good enough for Posh, Becks, Tom and Nicole, and home to Wordsworth's landlord, this overlooks Lake Windermere, with 10 luxury suites for up to six couples sharing. The price includes accommodation, breakfast, lunch and dinner, afternoon tea and unlimited champagne, wine and spirits. There is an additional charge of £500 per extra couple (or £300 per extra individual) per night in the remaining suites. Middleton Hall, Lothian and Borders (International Chapters 020 7722 0722). £5,460 for three nights, £12,005 for a week. Sleeps 20. Just 14 miles from Edinburgh, this magnificent Grade A-listed mansion house, was built around 1710 and is surrounded by a 113-acre estate with a trout-stocked burn and lake. Outdoor leisure facilities include mountain biking, a golf driving range, fishing, boating on the lake and beautiful walks around the estate. Clay pigeon shooting and archery are also available. Indoor facilities include snooker, gym and sauna, a games room and a table football. A cook can be arranged on request at extra cost. Bodysgallen Hall, nr Llandudno, Wales (01492 584466). £7,000 per night. Sleeps 70. A Grade I-listed building, built 1620, the hall sits in 200 acres of gardens and wooded parkland overlooking Snowdonia and nearby Conwy Castle. Its restaurant holds four red stars from the AA and the spa offers treatments by Clarins, Jessica and E'Spa, as well as a pool, gym, steam room, sauna and spa bath. For £7,000 a day (excluding Vat), plus a minimum spend of £2,000 (including Vat on food and beverage) you get exclusive use of the hotel and gardens.
